items.prompt: Describe the key components of the multi-store model of memory.
keyPoints: Sensory register: brief storage of sensory information
Short-term memory (STM): limited capacity and duration store
Long-term memory (LTM): potentially unlimited capacity and duration

markingCriteria.partial: Includes 1-2 key points or lacks detail

items.prompt: Explain how information is transferred between the stores in the multi-store model.
keyPoints: Attention transfers information from sensory register to STM
Maintenance rehearsal keeps information in STM
Elaborative rehearsal transfers information from STM to LTM

markingCriteria.partial: Includes 1-2 key points or lacks detail

items.prompt: Identify and describe the duration of each store in the multi-store model.
keyPoints: Sensory register: 0.25 to 0.5 seconds

Long-term memory: potentially a lifetime
